Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; POLISHED; PAINTED
Name: Amphora
Description: Amphora with narrow mouth, unmarked rim, short neck with barely marked concave walls and body with curved walls. The beginning of two vertical symmetrical handles are preserved. Orangey-coloured paste. Exterior surface with orangey-coloured coating, polished and partially lost. The piece bears a painted decoration of a double horizontal line in black. The top part presents a design of garlands in black.
